trans-unit.source: Instructs the debugger to step through the code instead of stepping into the code.
This attribute is provided for use by source code debuggers; the common language runtime is not affected by it.
For example, the Visual Studio debugger does not stop in a method that is marked with this attribute even if a breakpoint is set in the method.

The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThroughAttribute> attribute affects the [Just My Code](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0f0df097-bbaf-46ad-9ad1-ef5f40435079) (JMC) feature of Visual Studio in the following ways:
If JMC is enabled, the Visual Studio debugger will not stop at a breakpoint in a method marked with the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThroughAttribute> attribute.
If JMC is disabled, the debugger stops at the breakpoint even if the method is marked with the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThroughAttribute>.
The following code shows how the Visual Basic compiler uses the attribute.
This attribute avoids having to step into compiler-provided code and only steps into developer-provided code.
For example, if you are stepping through code by using the **F11** (Step Into) key, the attribute will cause the step to behave like an **F10** (Step Over) key for compiler-provided code.
The method wonâ€™t be stepped into, but it will be executed.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThroughAttribute"></xref> class.
